element_texts.text: Completed

postcard
postmark PHILADELPHIA 18 OCT 1969  PM
PHILADELPHIA  The Quaker City
WILLIAM PENN STATUE
Atop the tower of Philadelphia's famed City Hall,
looking out over the city he founded in 1682, stands William Penn, a
gigantic 37-foot statue of copper and bronze, weighing 53,348 pounds.
No point in all of Philadelphia is higher than William Penn's hat, which
rises 548 feet above the ground.

 Here enlightening students  At U. of Pa. Have been reading ROVER YOUNG

BLOOD underline enphone? /underline etc. Good stuff! Send review
in on my return this weekend. With Brotherly Love to all Bradleys

 JACK (the CONROY)
Mr. VaN ALLEN BRADLEY
Box 578
Lake Zurich ILLS  60047
Completed

photo of Jack Conroy

 Jack Conroy
Here's to Bonny Betty Campbell, who might

recall now and then the old feller who writ this

affectionately    Jack

St Charles
Oct 26  1968
Completed

12-14-73
Dear Betty -
Many many thanks for a most enjoyable evening, & a underline delicious /underline meal (which you
didn't eat enuff [sic]- of).

Anyway, here's a check for Jack's talk at Old Town. I'll mention you mentioned it to me ^ as a possibility

when I write him from Phoenix*, as well as send him a $100 check from underline December /underline -
as he is a writer for it - for which you owe me $100. somehow, if Jay Nash pays me, I wind up no loser. Just you

& him.
 Meanwhile, all I can think of for him to stay is at Jorg's. when I get back from Arizona I'll inquire. who the

hell is "Fred."     Thanks again,     Salud,  Curt

Looking forward to the 1st. Hope Fujii? called & came up w/ something.
Completed

underline Writers in Revolt /underline - autograph
To My Dear Friend

 Betty Campbell, who always brings the sunshine with her on her

pilgrimages to Moberly* and whose potent labors on behalf of this Collection
will never be forgotten by    Jack  "The Moberly Exile"

* Gladys says "Yea, boy!"

Moberly
Jan 28, 1973
Completed

Hope you had a good year Betty! When will you make the Moberly scene again.
Noel!    Jack

printed Holiday Greetings AND BEST WISHES FOR THE NEW YEAR

 Jack and Gladys Conroy
Completed

card Currier & Ives print of mill and horses, snow
The Old Mill added in pen - ^Gin  at Moberly, Mo.
upside down
underline Larry /underline  Robert called
Reached destination  everything OK
Has job and will pay back debts

 Job at $1 25 hour

Called from out of town -
in pencil [undated] Gift of Chi Hist. Soc 1992

postcard
stamp .40 FRANCAISE
postmark ..AUGIRARD.. 1965
printed Paris Et Ses Merveilles  Place de la Concorde
de droite a gauche: la tour Eiffel, l'obelisque de Louqset,
la Chambre des Deputes et, au fond, le dome des invalides.
VIVE LA FRANCE!!

Look who's wearing a beret, speaking perfect (Moberly-style)

French, and exchanging repartee with the Latin quarter & cettes
Haven't seen Seymour de Bovine as yet. Should I call?? Back to
London for two days, then Chicago that toddling town.    Love,

 Jack  THE MOBERLY RAMBLER  in pencil: Gift - Chi. Hist. Society - 1992

LARRY GOLDBERG, ESQ.
2633 West Balmoral
Chicago, ILLS. 60625
ETATS-UNIS d'AMERIQUE
Completed

Dear Irv.

 The Black Avenger of Moberly, Mo, is in town.

Where's my underline live moi? /underline ?
Will be back     Guess who?
drawing of  comical figure muerte
Completed

printed Anyplace But Here /printed

Here's a salute to Irv and Thelma Meyer

who are - started to say Conoisseurs [sic]
but forgot how to spell it - good judges of
swell and beautiful letters - or else why
should they have this book.     Best from

  Jack

Chicago  May 9, 1967
Completed

For Irving Meyers  not only an adornment to the legal profession but a damned good
judge of literature, as witnessed by his persistent interest in this book and its author

 with the thanks and best wishes of     Jack

Chez Romaine
July 12, 1963

 underline THE DISINHERITED /underline

Feliz Navidad y prospero ano nuevo
Joyeux Noel.

also  Merry Christmas
  Gladys & Jack Conroy

in pencil to Wharton
HOTEL STATLER CLEVELAND

Dear Wallie:
  Hope everything is proceeding per schedule. Friend Emerson price, with whom you once

conducted an involuntary correspondence, will be singing and dancing m.c. at the autobiography
party, it's a nasty day, but maybe that will put people in the mood for a little humor.

 Tell Jean he ought also to "contact" (big business stuff!) Edwa Moser and enlist her support.

"Every little helps" as the old woman said when she urinated in the sea.

 Save me one (or preferable more) copies of Jean's pd? review, will you?
 Tell Balch to get the rag out of his rectum and to see that all the "show folks" attend - and levy? !

Best   Jack
